main event: On 15 Sep 1956 in Fairview, New Jersey, a civilian observed a reddish and orange object resembling the size of a pin at arm's length. The object stood still at times, increased in size, and moved west slowly for about 10 minutes.
interesting points: The witness observed the object visibly and through binoculars for 10 minutes.
The report suggested that the object was possibly a balloon based on its movement, descent, and other characteristics.
No noise was reported emanating from the object during the sighting.
The object appeared reddish and orange with jagged edges and irregular behavior.
The witness provided a detailed description of the course and observations made during the 15-minute sighting.
sighted object: Reddish and orange object resembling the size of a pin at arm's length
